data.title: Dayton, Ohio (ET) Time Converter
data.text:
Compared to other cities in Ohio, Dayton has a unique blend of events and traditions that celebrate its diverse culture. The city is located within a few hours' drive of popular tourist destinations such as the Rock and Roll Hall of Fame in Cleveland and the National Museum of the United States Air Force in Dayton. It takes approximately 30 minutes to travel to suburbs such as Kettering, Beavercreek, and Centerville from downtown Dayton.

Spring

Average temperature: 50-70째F

Climate: Mild with occasional rain showers

Unique traditions and events: Dayton Air Show, Dayton Celtic Festival

Average daylight: 12-14 hours

Summer

Average temperature: 70-85째F

Climate: Warm and humid with occasional thunderstorms

Unique traditions and events: Dayton Blues Festival, Dayton African American Cultural Festival

Average daylight: 14-15 hours

Fall

Average temperature: 50-70째F

Climate: Cool and crisp with occasional rain showers

Unique traditions and events: Dayton Art Institute Oktoberfest, Dayton Fall Festival

Average daylight: 10-12 hours

Winter

Average temperature: 20-40째F

Climate: Cold with occasional snow showers

Unique traditions and events: Dayton Holiday Festival, Dayton Winter Beer Festival

Average daylight: 9-10 hours

Dayton is a city located in the southwestern part of Ohio, United States. It falls under the Eastern Time Zone (ET) and is 5 hours behind Coordinated Universal Time (UTC-5). The nearest timezone border is approximately 50 miles away, and it is in the Central Time Zone (CT). The travel time to the nearest states, Indiana and Kentucky, is around 1-2 hours by car. Dayton's neighboring cities include Kettering, Beavercreek, and Huber Heights. If someone were to drive from Dayton across America, it would take approximately 36 hours. Learn more about traveling to Dayton and explore its rich history and culture.
